TopicTitle: How does KSP know that a part can be a root part?

Articles.Content: Hy all, is there a configuration parameter that tells ksp whether or not a part can be the root part? I presume that having a ModuleCommand would be one factor but what if you don't have one in the config file? What else tells ksp that the part can be a root part?
It's something to do with what attachment nodes are available,

It's something to do with what attachment nodes are available,

Oooo that's a good hint, thanks. now I can look at what parts cannot be root and see what they do!
A part that's only surface attachable (no node_stack definitions) can't be a root part. I don't believe there are any other defining factors, but my knowledge may not be comprehensive.

a part must have stack-attach-to-it and surf-attach-to-it enabled for it to be a root part.

That was true as of a couple versions back, doubt it's changed.
